answers.answer: I had preeclampsia with my first one. Didn't know I had it until one day blood pressure shot up, 3 days later I had to have csection at 28 weeks.Its good they are monitoring you. My baby wasn't growing inside so I had to deliver. But since you don't have blood pressure, the baby should still be growing normally.With my current pregnancy I've been taking baby aspirin, flex seed oil and a total of 1500mg of calcium every day in addition to prenatal vitamins. I'm now 41 weeks getting ready to deliver and luckily haven't had any signs of preeclamsia.So I'd ask about baby aspirin and other supplemets. They've are supposed to help. Also, I had severe preeclampsia, so even if you get it there are different levels. If its mild, you should still be able to carry the baby to term.

I am being monitored for it too.My doctor seems to advise that the blood pressure is the one to watch for.You need to be on medical leave or bed rest, in my opinion.It has helped me a lot and I am 34+5 weeks pregnant now.If you get a headache in the back of your head or experiencing any chest pain or seeing spots call the doctor or go in to get checked.Those are the warning signs I am asked about each doctor visit and I go 3-4 times a week
My results came back I am positive for preeclampsia and now I'm going to be seeing my doctor every week. Still no high blood pressure just lots of protein in my urine and constant headaches
I had preeclampsia for my first born luckily it didn't develpe, but i do recall having pain on the upper right side of my belly and i began gaining a lot of weight

question: Can anyone give me information on this. The doctors are watching me very closely now even gave me two shots of staroids on my butt to help the baby's lung develop quicker , should I be nervous? I have all the symptoms of preeclampsia BUT the high blood pressure, I thought that would be a good think but I still have blood and pretotien in urine so it's like they're waiting for the high blood pressure to start or something. I don't know & I definitely don't know what to think , they don't even want me working and my baby is due in May
title: Preeclampsia
